gruppe.irc

Class IRCClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • gruppe.irc.IRCClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IRCConnection

    public class IRCClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main class of the IRC - Client. It contains all the vital parts of the program and keeps track of everything.
    Author:
    Anders, Christian and Olaf.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • newServer

        public static void newServer()
        Creates the frame containing the first server.

      • destroyServer

        public static void destroyServer(java.lang.String serverName,
                 java.lang.String alias)
        Function that removes the IRCCFrame when close() has been called in IRCCOnnection. This ensures that it is possible to log into a server multiple times without being stopped by the checkExists() function.

      • sendInfo

        public void sendInfo(java.lang.String prefix,
            java.lang.String command,
            java.lang.String alias,
            java.lang.String serverName,
            java.lang.String message)
        Method that receives all info from the IRCConnections. Then sends it to all the TabManagers via their frames.
        Parameters:
        prefix -
        command -
        message -

      • checkIfExists

        public java.lang.Boolean checkIfExists(java.lang.String serverName,
                              java.lang.String alias)
        Checks if we are already connected to a server with this name, using this nick. A message-dialog pops up if this is the case.
        Parameters:
        serverName - - The name of the server to check.
        alias - - The nick to check
        Returns:
        true if server and nick exists.

      • newConnection

        public void newConnection(IRCConnection newConnection,
                 java.lang.String serverName,
                 java.lang.String alias)
        Method that receives connections from IRCConnection, First checking if there are any empty frames (like the ones when starting the ircclient). If there are no empty frames, a new one is created.
